channel.title: My ::pnpc doesent work, allways changes me to same NPC

item.title: My ::pnpc doesent work, allways changes me to same NPC
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“super-expres, post:14, topic:167782”][quote author=`Rich link=topic=227227.msg1953433#msg1953433 date=1198640892]
Ok, don’t use ::pnpc

If you want to be jad, say:

::setnpc 2745

then say ::addnpc 2745 - After you do that, move a Square, and you’ll become Jad, Just change the NPCID to the Npc you want to become

[/quote]

Didnt Worked i still change to hans.[/quote]

mmmhmm same problem i am having tried all the above ^^^ and same result - HANS! lolz

editalso i know for me its a server side problem as i tried client on another source and ::setnpc works fine… so ya fault in the source somewhere… and crap just relised this is old topic - sorry edit

Read full topic

item.title: My ::pnpc doesent work, allways changes me to same NPC
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote=“new Nub();, post:7, topic:167782”]elite your problem is simple your not saying which npc.

you gotta use as:
::pnpc 1000

for example. because by what you’ve told us the npc doesnt change. hence your not telling it to and the substring is at the right place.[/quote]

::pnpc just doesn’t work with Dodian sources for Some reason, download the source and test it. I learned it awhile ago.

item.title: My ::pnpc doesent work, allways changes me to same NPC
item.dc:creator: @elitescouter elitescouter
item.description:
@elitescouter wrote:

I dont know what it is but my PNPC does not work like its suppose to, it allways turns me into a same NPC. I am using dodian source.

Here is my pnpc command:

if (command.startsWith("pnpc") && (playerRights > 1)) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) { npcId = newNPC; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }

And I turn into this EVERY SINGLE TIME!!! It won’t change into anything else! Please help

Read full topic
item.source: My ::pnpc doesent work, allways changes me to same NPC
